Description: Cancer vaccine that induces active immunity remains attractive. HANG can easily embed various substances, and after subcutaneous inoculation, it migrates to lymph nodes and enables activation/proliferation of infused cells through activated APC. In mice models conducted as preclinical studies, we observed robust proliferation/activation of infused cells in various organs including tumor tissues and complete eradications of established tumors. Intensive analysis revealed the induction of host long-lasting immune responses against various neo-antigens other than vaccinated antigens, that is, “Antigen-Spreading”. The HANG vaccine is expected to maximize the efficacy of cell therapy, and preparations for combinatorial clinical trial are underway.
Location: Spotlight Theater D - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
SearchResultBody: ESP6D. A novel cancer vaccine based on hyaluronic acid nanogel (HANG) with the ability of leading to “cure” in combination with T cell therapy
